org.turbogwt.ext.gwtp.databind.client

Class BindingViewImpl<H extends BindingUiHandlers>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.ViewImpl
      • com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.ViewWithUiHandlers<H>
        • org.turbogwt.ext.gwtp.databind.client.BindingViewImpl<H>
  • Type Parameters:
    H - Your BindingUiHandlers interface type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IsWidget, com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.HasUiHandlers<H>, com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.View, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.client.Binder, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.client.BindingValidationHandler, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.client.BindingView, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.client.HasBindingHandler, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.client.HasBindingValues, org.turbogwt.mvp.databind.client.WidgetBinder

    public class BindingViewImpl<H extends BindingUiHandlers>
extends com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.ViewWithUiHandlers<H>
implements BindingView<H>
    Base class for a BindingView. You should always call ViewWithUiHandlers.setUiHandlers(com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.UiHandlers) from your presenter's constructor.

    Important! Never call ViewWithUiHandlers.getUiHandlers() inside your constructor since the UiHandlers are not yet set.

    Author:
    Danilo Reinert
